definition: grasshopper
grass/straw/manuscript/draft (of a document)/careless/rough/CL:棵[ke1],撮[zuo3],株[zhu1],根[gen1]
variant of 肏[cao4]
grasshopper

sentences.english: On the grass, grasshoppers singing near by them with gi gi zi zi .
sentences.chinese: 草地上，唧唧織織的草蜢不時在旁和聲高唱。

sentences.english: He looked like a grasshopper in a fit when he did the new step.
sentences.chinese: 他學跳新舞步時像個痙攣的草蜢。

sentences.english: Kara ok software web site sent by the combination of deductive Grasshoppers oldies "High Fidelity."
sentences.chinese: 網站送上由草蜢組合演繹的老歌失戀。

sentences.english: Grasshopper performing at a Singapore charity show on tv 2007. Still as cool as ever. Enjoy.
sentences.chinese: 草蜢在新加坡慈善節目上的精彩表演。

sentences.english: How to make a lively grasshopper with leaves.
sentences.chinese: 如何利用樹葉編織製作栩栩如生的草蜢。

sentences.english: Three grasshoppers camouflaged in the leaves add to the realism.
sentences.chinese: 三隻草蜢趴正在葉兒下增減了做品的隱真感。

sentences.english: In the field nearby there lived a grasshopper.
sentences.chinese: 附近的地裏那裏住着一位草蜢。

sentences.english: They still go up to the grasshopper.
sentences.chinese: 它們仍然會向草蜢撲過去。

sentences.english: Grasshoppers singing their song Ban Dian Xing on a Singapore variety programme many years ago.
sentences.chinese: 草蜢多年前在新加坡綜藝節目上演唱歌曲《半點星》。

sentences.english: Grasshopper is the only "different species" I found today.
sentences.chinese: 草蜢是今天唯一發現的“異種”。

Jonathan Lee (1958-), Taiwanese record producer and songwriter
Ekin Cheng (1967-), Hong Kong actor and pop singer
Golden Melody Awards
David Tao (1969-), Taiwanese singer-songwriter
to cook on a skewer/barbecued food on a skewer/shish kebab/(fig.) to perform or play songs in sequence/sequence of songs/medley
music circles/music world
singing stage/music business (esp. pop music)
shidaiqu, a musical genre that originated in Shanghai in the 1920s, a fusion of Chinese folk music and Western jazz
younger sister
Nan Quan Mama, a Taiwanese Music Group
